abstract: The fields to return when fetching the root record.
overview:
## Discussion

For a shared record hierarchy, and when [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/shouldFetchRootRecord] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], set this property to specify which of the root record’s fields the operation fetches. Use `nil` to fetch the entire record. CloudKit ignores this property for a shared record zone because, unlike a hierarchy, it doesn’t have a nominated root record.

The default value is `nil`.

# rootRecordDesiredKeys

**Instance Property**

The fields to return when fetching the root record.

## Declaration

```swift
var rootRecordDesiredKeys: [CKRecord.FieldKey]? { get set }
```

## Discussion

For a shared record hierarchy, and when [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/shouldFetchRootRecord] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], set this property to specify which of the root record’s fields the operation fetches. Use `nil` to fetch the entire record. CloudKit ignores this property for a shared record zone because, unlike a hierarchy, it doesn’t have a nominated root record.

The default value is `nil`.
title: rootRecordDesiredKeys
